derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin, literally more'

encyclopedia.content: 公司介绍 PLUS（普乐士），创自于1948年，自独创的世界首部电子白板惊艳上市以来，以其独有的高品质的读取质量、先端的核心技术、节能环保的材质构造、人性化的功能设置，外加精美简洁的外形工艺等特色，六十年来风靡全世界，并成为日本电子白板畅销第一品牌。2000年，电子白板世家普乐士正式“移师”中国，秉承“立足全球、放眼中国”的战略目标，经过近10年的本土化创新发展，在中国引发电子白板销售热潮，普乐士热浪正全面席卷

entry.def: You say plus to show that one number or quantity is being added to another.

example.ex: Send a cheque for £18.99 plus £2 for postage and packing...
example.tran: 请寄上18.99英镑的支票，外加2英镑的邮资和包装费。

example.ex: They will pay about $673 million plus interest.
example.tran: 他们将支付约6.73亿美元再加上利息。

entry.def: Plus before a number or quantity means that the number or quantity is greater than zero.

example.ex: The aircraft was subjected to temperatures of minus 65 degrees and plus 120 degrees.
example.tran: 这架飞机经历了零下65度和零上120度的温度变化。

entry.def: You can use plus when mentioning an additional item or fact.

example.ex: There's easily enough room for two adults and three children, plus a dog in the boot...
example.tran: 能宽宽松松容下两个大人、三个孩子，而且后备箱里还可以放只狗。

example.ex: We had to have an actor who could generate real empathy. Plus he had to carry the audience through a lot of plot.
example.tran: 我们得找一名能真正入戏的男演员，而且他还得能让观众跟上复杂的剧情中。

entry.def: You use plus after a number or quantity to indicate that the actual number or quantity is greater than the one mentioned.

example.ex: There are only 35 staff to serve 30,000-plus customers...
example.tran: 只有35名员工，却要为3万多顾客服务。

example.ex: Among the guests were 16 high-flying executives, all on salaries of £50,000 a year plus.
example.tran: 客人中有16位极为成功的主管，年薪都超过了5万英镑。

entry.tran: （用于给学生作业评分）好于…的，高于…的
entry.def: Teachers use plus in grading work in schools and colleges. 'B plus' is a better grade than 'B', but it is not as good as 'A'.
A plus is an advantage or benefit.

example.ex: Experience of any career in sales is a big plus...
example.tran: 任何销售领域的工作经验都是一大优势。

example.ex: There are plenty of plus points about being an older first-time mum.
example.tran: 年龄稍长再做妈妈有很多好处。

sentences.en: If the input voltage is plus three, it comes out as minus six.
sentences.cn: 如果输入的电压是+3伏, 那么输出的电压便是-6伏。

sentences.en: He seems to have mistaken a minus for a plus.
sentences.cn: 他似乎把负号误作正号了。

sentences.en: He calculated his gains and losses of money and the result was a plus.
sentences.cn: 他把所得与所亏钱数计算了一下, 结果是盈余。

sentences.en: All the children here are 12 plus.
sentences.cn: 这里的孩子都是12岁以上的。

means.word_mean: 附加的, 称心的, 有利的

sentences.en: Her previous experience in social work is a plus factor.
sentences.cn: 她先前在社会工作方面的经验是一个有利因素。

sentences.en: He plused three more points in the game.
sentences.cn: 他在比赛中又得了三分。
